alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Hooker; Logan; McPherson; Thomas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 10:22PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Arthur, southeastern Cherry, Hooker, northwestern Logan, northern McPherson and Thomas Counties through 1115 PM CDT/1015 PM MDT/... At 1021 PM CDT/921 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Seneca to 7 miles west of Tryon. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mullen, Thedford, Tryon, Seneca, Flatts, Big Lamunyon Flats, East Cody Lake, Norway, Sand Beach Lake, Bucktail, Natwick, Schnick Lake, Hecla, Kelso and Shimmons Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 173 and 218. Highway 92 between mile markers 177 and 197. Highway 97 between mile markers 32 and 70. Highway 83 between mile markers 135 and 156. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT/1100 PM MDT/ for north central and west central Nebraska.
